alert.note: Alert for El Paso (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 26 at 10:59PM MDT until July 27 at 6:55AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Colorado... Fountain Creek At Colorado Springs affecting El Paso County. For the Fountain Creek...including Colorado Springs, Fountain Creek near Fountain...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Fountain Creek At Colorado Springs. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Action Stage. Water flows over the Front Range Trail under the South Nevada Avenue Bridge. Homeless community encampment may be affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 7.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.0 feet just after midnight tonight. - Action stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood stage is 11.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 700 AM MDT.
